attempt_history.review_text: Blasted through a pickup basketball game in these disasters, and the soles started shredding midway. Gym squats? Agonizing pinch at the toes from shoddy sizing. Even light running trails left my feet raw and unsupported. Cheap materials crumbled under real training—steer clear if you're active.

attempt_history.review_text: These shoes seemed promising for my morning walks, easing the strain on my aging knees at first glance. Yet, the stiff soles aggravated my foot pain quickly, lacking the arch support I need with arthritis. Quality appears average, though the leather holds up modestly. They pinch in the toes too, despite choosing a half-size up. Not ideal for mobility-limited folks seeking all-day ease.

Only quibble: they run slightly loose next to the newest Adidas Ultraboosts, so I sized down. Solid pick for tech-forward strides.
